item.title: Build Up by BonerBob
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: We’re in the lead up to Valentine’s 2021, time to start gettin’ romantic. Today BonerBob is here with a sweet tease of a comic. Atmospheric, human, and lovely look at the longing of our imaginations and the reality of actually being alone with your crush. A slice of life that I feel like we’ve all […]
item.content:encoded:
Build Up by BonerBob

by Matthew Nolan on 02/02/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Smutty Comics »
  • Guest Story Comics

We’re in the lead up to Valentine’s 2021, time to start gettin’ romantic.

Today BonerBob is here with a sweet tease of a comic. Atmospheric, human, and lovely look at the longing of our imaginations and the reality of actually being alone with your crush. A slice of life that I feel like we’ve all been through, maybe even more so during the quarantine.
I hope you all enjoy it! Do make sure to go say hello to BonerBob on their social. They’re currently working on another comic for us that I think is an absolute delight.

  • Twitter
  • Patreon

Next week we’ve got a smuttier comic to really land the valentines with. After that, it’s open sky. Erika and I are gonna get a few reviews done and, hopefully, I’ll have a few guests hand in some comics. A reminder that we’re always hiring for comics!

If you’re looking for last minute sexy gifts for Valentines, check out our Best-of-2020 Comic here!

└ Tags: apprehension, Boner Bob, BonerBob, fantasy, feelings, fiction, flirt, guest, guest comic, tease, tension

item.title: The Stress Response Cycle
item.dc:creator: Erika Moen
item.description: “How to De-stress” on Women’s Health Magazine goes more in-depth with some of the methods you can use to complete the stress cycle. God only knows I’m trying my best when I summarize big concepts into simplified comics and my Cliff Notes version is bound to come up short to the original theory, so I […]
item.content:encoded:
The Stress Response Cycle

by Erika Moen on 01/26/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Health »
  • Literature

“How to De-stress” on Women’s Health Magazine goes more in-depth with some of the methods you can use to complete the stress cycle. God only knows I’m trying my best when I summarize big concepts into simplified comics and my Cliff Notes version is bound to come up short to the original theory, so I really truly encourage everyone to read my source material for yourself by picking up a copy of Emily and Amelia Nagoski’s book:

  • Burnout @ Amazon
  • Burnout @ Powells
  • Burnout @ Bookshop

Or you can listen to them talk about their book and the stress response cycle, too! Watch them at XOXO Fest, listen to their podcast: Feminist Survival Project 2020, or listen to them talk about it with Brené Brown on her podcast Unlocking Us.

If you are thinking to yourself, hmm, this Emily person sounds familiar…? that is because she and her brilliant work have popped up more than once in some previous OJST comics!
► The Science of Desire (Guest comic illustrated by Rich Stevens)
► Come as You Are Book review (spoilers, we love it)
► A Version of the Sexual Response Cycle (based on Dr. Nagoski’s book on the same subject)

└ Tags: baseline, burn out, Burnout, emily nagoski, responce, Stress response cycle, stressor, Stressresponsecycle

by Matthew Nolan on 01/12/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Review Comics »

A biodegradable toy for under $20? Fuck yes that’s the sort of energy I NEED for 2021.

I do feel a pang of small guilt at not having given the week to the quad-fucker-fuckin-fucker-machine, but honestly – you need to have a real thirst to get yourself ready for that beastie. We’ll get to it sure, but right now? With the world the way it is? We need something kinder.

Say hello to an amazing pair of toys for any of you who are brand new to the world of vibes.

We’re happy to have her back with a slice of life and a frank n’ real conversation about having kids in her Poly Triad relationship. This sort of wholesome loving chat is […]
item.content:encoded:
Having Kids In Our Poly Triad by Sara Valta

by Matthew Nolan on 01/05/2021 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Story Comics »
  • Interviews »
  • Sex & Sexuality

Sara’s back! You might remember a couple of years ago she’d shared with us a comic on her first year in a polyamory! We’re happy to have her back with a slice of life and a frank n’ real conversation about having kids in her Poly Triad relationship.

This sort of wholesome loving chat is just the thing we need for the start of 2021.

Don’t forget to tell Sara how awesome she is! Then if you’re feeling generous, consider signing up for a month or two on her Patreon!

  • Twitter
  • Instagram
  • Patreon

Erika and I are back to work this week – brewing up a comic for Tuesday!

It’s the start of 2021 and we are so dang thankful of each and every one of you. Thank you for still coming back here and reading our comics and supporting the work we do!

└ Tags: children, guest, guest comic, interview, kids, poly, polyamorous, polyamory, sara valta, saravalta, triad, trio

Me-ouch indeed!

Today we’re excited to be sharing a lovely comic from Nicnak! An amazing furry artist and jack of all trades. Like seriously – she even makes and sells cute animal masks!

I was really excited to get such an honest and fun slice of autobio about this particular kink into pain, and then doubly so when she handed it in – I think it’s just stunning. I hope you like it too!

  • The Art of Nicole

Erika and I are still taking some down time, so there’s another guest comic to come before we jump back into the grind! We hope your all having a best-as-can-be-had holiday period.

Go take a peek at both of these two’s grand works! Let them know if you liked today’s comic, and hopefully, it’ll persuade them to do another ;D

  • Instagram

Today’s guest comic is the first of three we’ll be posting up in a row, as we take a bit of time off and do some of the work things we’ve been putting off! Hopefully, they’ll find you all doing well and staying safe despite everything. <3

item.title: Best Of 2020
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: This year’s been like pushing through molasses, you all are amazing for making it this far. With everything the way it’s been, I think we’re all feeling empty, worn out, and low on libido– at least, Erika and I are. Which is ok! Sex is supposed to be fun and good for everyone involved. If […]
item.content:encoded:
Best Of 2020

by Matthew Nolan on 12/15/2020 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Review Comics

This year’s been like pushing through molasses, you all are amazing for making it this far.

With everything the way it’s been, I think we’re all feeling empty, worn out, and low on libido– at least, Erika and I are. Which is ok! Sex is supposed to be fun and good for everyone involved. If 2020’s getting to you and you ain’t feeling it: don’t push yourself, don’t stress out about it, explore other ways to stay connected and intimate that may not involve your genitals. Focus on being kind to yourself, friends. Sex and sex toys can wait.

But for those of you who are feeling it or for when the mood takes you in the future: we got you. This list is here for you! Oh, but first, let us be cheeky and drop a link to where you can buy/pre-order our two newest sex education books ;)

Our Books!

  • Drawn to Sex: Our Bodies and Health
  • Let’s Talk About It

We didn’t really add too many new names to the list this year. Instead, you’re getting the tried and true few, the ones we DO keep near and dear. If it’s not enough of a selection, take a peek at what we thought was the best in the last handful of years! We covered a few more categories in the older comics. Plus it’s just fun to see how much our art has changed year to year.
2019 – 2017 & 18 – 2016 – 2015 – 2014

Buy from our Friends (with Benefits)!

  • UK
  • EU

  • CAN

item.title: Gender Turbulence by Oli Franey
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: Oli’s here talking about their gender. Today’s comic was a lovely one to get, so I’m glad to finally share it with you all. We hope you like it! Portfolio Twitter Instagram Wanna read more comics on Gender and Sexuality? Check out the archives! In some fun and exciting news – Erika and I did […]
item.content:encoded:
Gender Turbulence by Oli Franey

by Matthew Nolan on 12/08/2020 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Story Comics »
  • Interviews »
  • Sex & Sexuality

Oli’s here talking about their gender. Today’s comic was a lovely one to get, so I’m glad to finally share it with you all. We hope you like it!

  • Portfolio
  • Twitter
  • Instagram

Wanna read more comics on Gender and Sexuality? Check out the archives!

In some fun and exciting news – Erika and I did our numbers, and while we still haven’t paid off the whole of our Kickstarter yet (waiting on one last bill), we’re going to be using the cash we DID get to increase our guest artist page rates! From now on, we’ll be paying folks $140 a page (each comic is 4-5 pages long), and $160 a page for returning artists. As always, all the work done for OJST is creator-owned, so artists keep all the rights to their work. It’s still a long way from a professional Marvel or DC rate, but we’re still pretty proud. For just two nerds running a lil ol sex-ed webcomic, the idea that we can now pay $700-$800 for a comic is amazing.

With that in mind, we are constantly hiring for guest comics.

More of a hubaballoo to come about that in the next few days =)

└ Tags: autobio, binary, gender, guest, guest comic, non-binary, oli franey, queer

item.content:encoded:

by Matthew Nolan on 11/17/2020 at 12:02 am
  • Adventures »
  • Comic »
  • Favorites

Erika’s sick in bed today (Monday as I write this), so I’m doing all the prep work for today’s comic. Usually, I’d write all kinds of thing-a-ma-bobs, but since I know Erika will want to fill this blog post up with all kinds of helpful stuff. I’m going to leave it pretty sparse, so she can come in and replace it all when she feels better.

Check back later on, and hopefully, Erika will have written up something.
As always, hope this finds you happy and well friends.

by Matthew Nolan on 11/10/2020 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Reviews »
  • Guest Story Comics »

Mariana’s back! You might remember her lovely work form only a few months back when she made us a comic about the struggles with hook-up culture. Welp, today we’re lucky to have her return, this time talking all about Lingerie and her gradual growth into BDSM clothing.

It’s just lovely and Mariana is so frigging talented. Go let her know and maybe drop her a coffee or two ;D

  • Twitter
  • Portfolio
  • Tumblr
  • Instagram
  • Kofi

Just in case today’s comic has piqued your interest, go check out some of our other comics on this subject!
– Lingerie Comics
– Comics on Kinks
– Interview comics

Then, if you’re in the mood to buy Lingerie, our recommendation would be to go out to one of those fancy stores and physically try stuff on. It’s SO hard to find what fits and looks good on you without seeing it in a mirror. But… Covid. So instead we’d encourage you to buy online and maybe try our pals Lovehoney as they have a huge selection.

└ Tags: autobio, bdsm, clothes, guest, guest comic, kink, lingerie, Mariana Meira, underwear
